intro: Tremacanthus robertii, commonly known as the Robert's spurge, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are typically borne in inflorescences called cyathia. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in drought-tolerant gardens.
